project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issues that are still in a progress status and moved back to the backlog when closing a sprint shows the sprint they came from. If the issue then is placed in a new sprint this new sprint is presented along-side the previous. 

h3. Suggested Solution
We feel that there should be a clear distinction in the presentation of the sprints in this case, perhaps a strike-out on the sprint name from which the issue was not completed in, or maybe marked in red color.
fields.summary: previous sprint should have clear distinction

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Most of the times we have some issues that are not completed (resolved or closed) when we close a sprint. These issues gets automatically moved to the backlog but still they are in the same status (In Progress or any other status prior to resolved or closed).

h3. Suggested Solution
We suggest that all issues in the backlog should be evaluated regarding prior and time estimates. It should offer some option to automatically change the status of the issues described earlier to some specific status when we close the sprint.
fields.summary: Changing status on issues when closing sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello!

Is there a way I can filter the issues that generated a scope change of a certain Sprint besides the Burndown Chart of the Reports on the Board?

Thanks!
fields.summary: How to get Scope Change Issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing an issue that has sub-tasks, if you click on the gear of the sub-task and click "Rank to Top" or "Rank to Bottom" a pop up shows the issue has been updated but the screen does not refresh.  When you go back into the issue, the ordering of the sub-tasks remains the same.
fields.summary: Rank to Top and Rank to Bottom do not work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As an avid user of Agile Boards, I would like the ability to use color/styling/etc. on the Quick Filter names, so that it is easier to use multiple Quick Filters.

See the attachment for an example of how we use large numbers of filters.

!pic.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support markup/html tags for Quick Filter names

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today is possible to add/remove extra fields in JIRA Agile cards, however is not possible to remove any of the default fields (_Issue Key_ and _Summary_).

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to manage all fields from the Agile Cards, including the default ones, so the administrator can define which information is important to show to the users.
fields.summary: Ability to customize all information from Agile Cards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I'd like to have an easy way to create a report of points completed by epic.  This helps our stakeholders know where our efforts have gone, and how far we have to go.  Ideally one would be able to choose the timeframe for this report (this sprint, in a past sprint, for the past __ sprints, since the beginning of the project, etc.).

Right now I'm creating this in Excel, so it would be wonderful to have something automatic.   Thanks for considering!
fields.summary: Create a report of points completed by epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Each time I update the JIRA Agile plugin, the Epic Link and/or Sprint custom field is added to most of my screens automatically.
* Many of my issue types do not use this field, and its appearance creates confusion among my users
* It seems that this is being added to all screens that are designated for "Create" in my Screen Schemes.
* I have confirmed audit logs and none of my administrators are doing this, It's definitely happening as a result of the JIRA Agile plugin updates.
fields.summary: Epic and Sprint fields automatically added to screens after plugin update

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When the user starts a sprint, user can specify *start date* and *end date*. However, JIRA Agile will not count it as 1 working day if it's less than 24 hours. This causes sprint to have less expected working days specified.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create sprint
# Set start date, for example {{17/Aug/15 12:05 AM}}
# Set end date, for example {{17/Aug/15 11:59 PM}}

h4. Expected result
JIRA Agile will count it as 1 working day, as it already passes 8 working hours (normal working hour)

h4. Actual result
JIRA Agile count it as *0 working days*
!start.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional Information
When the customer sets the date from August 17th - August 21st, it will count it as 4 working days, where it actually 5 working days. This will affect the report for the users.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile does not count working day for sprint if it's less than 24 hours

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

is it possible to fix this behavior?
1. Go to the board (Backlog)
2. Select any item (detail view appears on the right)
3. Resize the detail view (see attachment)
4. Problem as described and shown in last screenshot
fields.summary: Jira Alaska Board resize is not working correctly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Description
Velocity chart shows only data for last 7 sprints. This is undesirable if it is needed to see the reports from older sprints.

h4. Suggestion
Allow the chart to include more sprints on report. If possible, make it configurable via user interface.
fields.summary: Allow Velocity Chart report to show more than last 7 past sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When adding Liked Issue field on the card layout I'd expect that it would also reflect the status of those linked issues.

E.g.: SSP-14 has SSP-18 linked. SSP-18 is closed and strikethrough but the same does not happen on the card layout.
!Screen Shot 2015-08-18 at 2.20.35 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Link does not reflect the actual status of the issue on Card Layout

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Problem description
If a quick filter is set on Backlog for a Scrum Board and no issues are visible for a *started* sprint, then it will not be possible to drag & drop issues to this sprint. 
If a single issue is visible on the started sprint then the drag & drop functionality will work properly.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Scrum Board and some sample issues
# Create a sprint and start it
# Apply a filter which causes no issues are visible within the sprint mentioned on step #2
# Try to drag & drop issues to this sprint. They will not be moved or will be moved to the first not started sprint on the board. No error is thrown on log files or on the user interface.

h4. Work-around
Right click on the issue and then select the destination sprint *OR* use drag & drop without quick filters active on the board
fields.summary: Drag & drop does not work when a quick filter is selected on Backlog mode and no issues are visible for a started sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
All Epics for all issues in the Backlog in a scrum board should be visible by default.

Today only the Epics included in the filter query is visible in the Backlog of a scrum board. This is a problem since we are using filter queries including issues from many projects marked up with a label or a Team. (Different teams are involved in issues from the same projects.)
fields.summary: In the Backlog all Epics linked to visible issues should be visible

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Too many clicks for an action makes users angry, disoriented, and resist adoption. That's why this issue is critical. This is primary navigation functionality.

The "Recent Boards" list in the Agile board menu has a more link.
The More link links to the same list full-screen. It then requires clicking on the "All Boards" link on that screen to actually get what was originally reqested...."More".
fields.summary: More link in "Agile" menu should go to All boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The issues displayed in the backlog view of a project is quietly filtered based on the Board's columns config.
This is a problem because the backlog has no sense of columns yet uses the columns to filter issues. This relationship can only be discovered when issues go missing. 

If a board is configured such that issue status that are not resolved are put into a resolved (green) column, then they are no longer displayed on the backlog. When an issue is in the active sprint, this is not a big deal. However, once the active sprint is closed, there is no way in the Agile system to view this issue.
fields.summary: Issues can get lost because backlog doesn't use sense of "Resolved"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Sometimes, on a Kanban worfklow the team might want to release issues in pre-determined packages, for example: "Customers App - V1.1", "Products App V2.1" ,etc....

Usually these releases are combined with the customer on a periodic basis, so the versions are also pre-determined and the customer will be told something like "your issues 1, 2 and 3 will be released tomorrow, the rest next week". This implies, in this example, two diferent versions.

At this point the Kanban board disregards existing versions when releasing issues from the board. The release action just prompts the user for a version name and overwrites the existing FixVersion field if already set.

I ask for the following behaviour.
* Honor the existing FixVersion on the issues when releasing from the board.
* On the release dialog:
** Ask for the versions to be released (select distinct fix versions of unrelased issues) on a multi select box. Eg. Versions to release [ Customer-App-v1.1; Orders-App-v2.1; ]
** optionally ask for the remaining issues (FixVersion isNull) to be released on an existing version or a new one (similar behaviour to the Tags/Labels textbox that exists in jira where the user can pick an existing item or type a new one)
fields.summary: Kanban Release Action should allow the user to select an existing version

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: JQL function addedAfterSprintStart don't work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA Agile 6.7.11, when a sub-task is being resolved, it won't show as strike-through in the backlog view under scrum board.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.10
* JIRA Agile 6.7.11

* JIRA 6.4.9
* JIRA Agile 6.7.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a story and a sub-task under it
# Drag it into a Sprint
# Configure the scrum board under card layout to show the sub-task under Backlog
# Resolve the sub-task

h3. Expected Results
The sub-task is being display and strike-through under the plan view of the scrum board.

h3. Actual Results
The sub-task is being display and no strike-through under the plan view of the scrum board.

h3. Notes
In JIRA Agile 6.7.7, the sub-task is being display and strike-through under the plan view of the scrum board.
fields.summary: sub-task not strike-through in backlog JIRA Agile 6.7.11

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA Agile 6.7.11, the progress field in card layout in active sprint view is only showing percentage tracking. [^6.7.11.png]

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.10
* JIRA Agile 6.7.7
* JIRA Agile 6.7.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket and give it an estimation
# Add the ticket on an agile board as a card
# Configure the agile card to contain the 'Progress' field.

h3. Expected Results
It should the progress bar with percentage.

h3. Actual Results
It only show the percentage.

h3. Notes
In JIRA Agile 6.7.7, the progress field in card layout in active sprint view is showing both percentage and bar tracking. [^6.7.7.png]
fields.summary: progress field showing only percentage instead of percentage with bar in JIRA Agile 6.7.11

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issues appear as strikethrough in the Activity Stream when the resolution field is populated. This is a simple indication that the issue has been completed or done or resolved. However, issues don't get strikethrough in Agile reports (for example Burndown Chart) although they have a resolution. Hence, users don't know whether an issue is resolved or not

h3. Suggested Solution
Strikethrough issues that has a resolution field in the Agile reports

h3. Screenshots
!activity-stream-strikethrough.png|thumbnail!
!Burndown-Chart.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show strikethrough for issues that has been resolved in the Reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Description
As a JIRA Agile user we believe that feature enhancement would be when moving issues from one project to another to prompt the user if there is a current sprint set and if they want to clear that value.
This would avoid confusions when working with multiple sprints across projects.
fields.summary: Add alert when moving stories that already belong to a Sprint to another project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Improvement in documentation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Summary*
Board that contained multiple projects should not be able to see "All Reports" button

Steps to reproduce
# Create a board that contained 2 different projects in the filter
# Navigate to Agile Report
# Click on *All Reports* button

Current Behaviour:
The user will encounter the page or error message that tells: *This project isn't available. It may have been deleted or your permissions may have changed*

or

*Project should not be null!*

Expected behaviour:
*All Reports* button should not be there once the board contain multiple of projects.
fields.summary: Board that contained multiple projects should not be able to see "All Reports" button

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Velocity Report in in Agile currently only deals with built-in fields in JIRA Agile. If a client has created custom fields that they want to estimate velocity on instead, it's not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an ability to use another field for estimate.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to estimate velocity using custom fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When there is required field and the sprint field is not part of the create issue screen, then the issue created will end up in the backlog instead of the sprint.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Mark a field as mandatory in the create issue screen.
2. Remove the Sprint field from the create issue screen.
3. Go to the Backlog of the rapidboard.
4. Create a sprint.
5. Try to create an issue via the inline issue create of the sprint.
6. The create issue dialog pops-up because of the required field.
7. Enter the data in the required field and create issue.

Expected Result:
The issue is present in the sprint from which it was created.

Actual Result:
The issue ends up in the backlog.
fields.summary: Inline Issue Create loses sprint selection in cases with a required field and Sprint field is not present on screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
Complex JQL including linkedissues and Epic link throws out 500 Error

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an agile project (Let's called it project A) and board.
# Create at least two issues (A-1 and A-2) in the project
# Link those issues together using issue link
# Create an Epic
# Insert those two issues into the newly created Epic
# Create a filter as follows: {{Project =  A and "Epic Link" in (linkedissues("A-1")) }}
# Go to manage filter
# Click on the newly created filter

*Expected Result*
* The filter would work as expected

*Actual Result*
* An error 500 is thrown. The following shows on the logs:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkSearchInputTransformer.computeOperandsFromSearchValues(EpicLinkSearchInputTransformer.java:126) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkSearchInputTransformer.getClauseFromParams(EpicLinkSearchInputTransformer.java:102) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.transformer.AbstractCustomFieldSearchInputTransformer.getSearchClause(AbstractCustomFieldSearchInputTransformer.java:76) [jira-api-7.0.0-OD-01-193.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.generateQuery(DefaultSearcherService.java:294) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.searchWithJql(DefaultSearcherService.java:173) [?:?]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:317) [spring-aop-4.1.6.RELEASE.jar:4.1.6.RELEASE]
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56) [?:?]
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60) [?:?]
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179) [spring-aop-4.1.6.RELEASE.jar:4.1.6.RELEASE]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Complex JQL including linkedissues and Epic link throws out 500 Error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

JIRA Agile is marked as *INCOMPATIBLE* in the {{Administration >> Add-ons >> Manage add-ons}}

JIRA Agile operates without any incompatibility issue

h3. Actual Results
!6.7.7.png|thumbnail!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our team chooses names for sprints according to some theme (e.g., dog breeds) and in alphabetical order.  So ... Afghan hound, Beagle, Corgi, etc.  Right now, we are changing the project icon with each sprint.  

It would be nice if we could have an icon for an individual sprint.
fields.summary: be able to add an icon for an individual sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This page needs to be updated 
[Generating reports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Generating+Reports]. The image is old and it doesn't show the new Cloud interface and how to access the reports. It is missing to say how to access different reports, by clicking in the name of the chart.
fields.summary: Outdated documentation for JIRA Agile reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to create a custom field that shows available sprints for the project the issue is created for.
This should work similar to the versions field that can be reused as custom field.
fields.summary: Make Sprints an extended field-type for custom fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I put together JQL queries to indicate a board card colors such that 

{color:red}Red {color}– over 20 calendar days since this item was moved into this stage (note the issue could bounce around, between stages and this will turn red if the original time going into this stage was over 20 calendar days ago)
{color:#f6c342}Yellow {color}- over 10 calendar days since this item was moved into this stage
{color:#14892c}Green {color}– less than 10 calendar days since this item was moved into this stage

Here is a screen shot that shows my queries:

!color_cards_JIRA.jpg|thumbnail!

Being able to use indicators on our KANBAN board, such as color cards to to visually show items that are starting to become or have been stagnant makes the boards much more usable & informative.  However, this use of color cards makes the page extremely slow to load.  Clicking on any story for a detailed view results in a long pause for the end user as the page loads again.   On my team users do not want to work with this view, despite having it display useful information.  Can an alternative solution be provided or can this solution be made more efficient on the backend?
fields.summary: Long Page Load Time - Color Cards on Board to Indicate Duration In Status

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently in Plan mode of the Agile board, the estimation is summed for the sprint and specifically show how much estimation in which Status Categories. 

It would be nice to have if the estimation badge, highlighted in red below:

!planestimate.png!

Would not only show the estimate of the issue, but also place it according to the color of the status categories it belongs to.

It ease the overview of the board without having to navigate to the work mode to verify.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have Color Estimation Badge

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Rapid Board throws 500 error for empty board query

h3. Environment
* JIRA Agile version {{1000.163.1}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as an admin
# Go to the issues search and create a new filter with empty criteria.
# Create an agile board with the existing filter 
!13-board-saved-filter.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The empty board should be created

h3. Actual Results
When you hit create you see the 500 error page with the following stacktrace:
https://paste.internal.atlassian.com/view/16932
 
h3. Workaround
Re-indexing seems to resolve the issue.

h3. Notes
This does not happen all the time.
fields.summary: Rapid Board throws 500 error for empty board query

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Removing an issue from an Epic issue does not prompt indexing for the Epic issue, which results in inconsistent updated times when searching for the issue.

h3. Environment Tested Against
* JIRA 6.4.8
* JIRA Agile 6.7.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA and JIRA Agile
# Create Sample Scrum Project 
# Create and epic and add a few issues to it
# Observe the *Updated:* time on the Epic 
# Run an *Advance Search* for the issue (issue = epic issue key) and hover over the *updated* field to confirm the times match
# Remove an issue from the Epic 
# Re-run the advanced search and note the *updated* field is still the old value
# Navigate to the Epic and note the *updated* field correctly shows the time the issue was removed, however, the search results still show the old time

h3. Expected Results
The times should match between viewing the issue and returning search results

h3. Actual Results
The last updated time shown in the advanced search will not show the true updated time. See attached example screenshot (*note* it was about 3:45 when the screenshot was taken).

!time.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
Editing the issue will prompt a reindex to be done, which will fix the inconsistent times
fields.summary: Removing Issue From Epic Does Not Prompt Reindex of Epic Issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At this moment, in Kanban board, the time spent in status will be shown in the forms of dots. When the user hovers the cursor to the dots, it will show *X days in this column*.
!kanban.png|thumbnail!

It would be great to have the option to automatically show the time in status in the form of digit to ease the users.
fields.summary: Show time in status in digit (Kanban Board)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is related to GHS-5703. Not everyone uses numbers to indicate successive sprints; some people use letters.

Current behavior:

"Cool Sprint P" -> "Cool Sprint P 2"

Desired behavior:

"Cool Sprint P" -> "Cool Sprint Q"
fields.summary: If Sprint Name Ends with space+letter, increment the letter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently we do have epics however labels work just like #tags. Users apply several labels to a single story in order to 
# Remember it
# Differentiating
# Quick Search
# More Readable
fields.summary: As a user, I should be ale to change the color of labels for better visibility.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment, the active sprint mode in the board allows groups to be collapsed for easier overview. The setting of which group is collapsed is stored for the user, but not properly restored when the list of groups (typically, parent issues) changes.
For example:
Three parent issues (A, B, C) exist with subtasks
A and C are collapsed
When B is closed and removed from view, because of a 'hide closed' filter *{{status not in (Done)}}*
Then C is shown expanded

!before.png|thumbnail!
!after.png|thumbnail!

It would be great to keep the active sprint mode to be at the same state. Looking at the use case above, then it should be issue A and C will remain collapsed.
fields.summary: Having the ability for the active sprint mode in the board to keep the state (collapsed/expanded)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment, the following are the condition to complete sprint:
# Have the right permission.
# All sub-task belong to completed issues in that sprints are complete.

It would be great to have the ability to set our own condition on completing sprint. The options for the implementation could be one of the following:
* The *complete sprint* button should be disabled as long as the conditions have not been fulfilled yet.
* Or an error message should be popped up when completing the sprint showing the conditions need to be fulfilled.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to set conditions on completing sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the subtasks are ordered by Rank (I believe) in the view details and by subtask order when viewing the ticket fully.  

I haven't raised this as a bug, because I'm not sure what the correct order should be.

It is the issue view - so one could argue that it should look the same as viewing an issue in JIRA.  But we are in agile - so perhaps the rank order is more important.

If the rank order IS the correct way to go, there needs to be a way to rank the subtask from the planning mode.
fields.summary: Subtask ordering in details panel doesn't match the subtask order on view issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If the user has mistakenly or forgot to fill out a few fields, like the correct sprint for some tickets and the story points. The agile report will still stay as it is the original way.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can reset or re-generate the report with the latest changes applied
fields.summary: re-generate/reset report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When we try to see reports for finished sprints we see...

No issues present in sprint to generate scope change model

In all finished sprints. Active sprint is correct
fields.summary: No tasks in all Jira reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Strikethrough the resolved sub-taks when shown on card in the Backlog view of JIRA Agile is no longer working.

Agiles board was working as expected on JIRA Agile v6.7.7-D20150701T035938.
The issue is occuring on JIRA Agile v6.7.10-D20150729T044856 and JIRA Agile v6.7.11-D20150803T143051.

h3. Environment
-
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add sub-tasks on _Card Layout_
# Close a _Sub-task_ of a parent available on backlog
# Sub-task won't be strikethrough

h3. Expected Results
Resolved sub-tasks are strikethrough on Backlog view
!subtask1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Resolved sub-tasks aren't strikethrough on Backlog view
!agile.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
-
h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Strikethrough the resolved sub-tasks when shown on cards in JIRA Agile

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I'd like a way to exclude stories and only include sub-tasks for the column constraint in the Agile plugin.

For my use-case, I don't care how many stories are in-progress. For my team, sub-tasks are the only measure of "unit of work" and the story is complete when all sub-tasks are delivered. I'm looking for an option like "Issue Count, excluding parent issues" on the column constraint, which would function as the inverse of "Issue Count, excluding sub-tasks".
fields.summary: Add column constraint for "Issue Count, excluding parent issues"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The textual popup covers the text box where you are typing the JQL and you cannot see what you are typing when using Google Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the board configuration and select QuickFilters on the left menu.
# Type anything in the JQL field. 

h3. Expected Results
# To see the content that you're typing in.
!Screen Shot 2015-11-03 at 7.29.02 PM.png!

h3. Actual Results
The suggestions text box covers the JQL field and you're unable to see what you're typing in.
!Screen Shot 2015-11-03 at 7.25.38 PM.png!

h3.Solution / Workaround
# Use a different browser such Safari or Firefox.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete obscures view of the search text in board configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When board column "Done" status is changed to another column, all sprints reports, including reports for closed sprints, are modified.

The Burndown chart will show that no issues were closed within the sprint because the "Done" column is now different from the "Done" column when the sprint was active. The status in the "Done" column previously is now in a "In Progress" column, so reports show that no issue was Resolved during the sprint and thus, showing no estimates completed.

*Scenario:* A team decides to add a new step after the status that used to be the "Done" column (completion status) on previous sprints. 

*Suggestion*
JIRA Agile could save the Column settings when the sprint is closed to draw a Report accurate to the time the Sprint was Closed.
 
h3. Workaround:
Rename statuses. Instead of adding a step after the last status, change the name of the status to the new "Done" status and recreate the modified status.
fields.summary: Board column changes affects closed sprint reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Even when the Epic is closed it still showing on the painel what request to click in Mark as Done to remove it.
It should be gone at the first time closed.
fields.summary: Marking an Epic as "Done" Does Not Remove it from Epic board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you search a particular issue in backlog view, you are not allow to drag and drop the issue into the sprint which has already started.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.9
* JIRA Agile 6.7.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two issues (issueA and issueB) in the board
# Create two sprint (sprintA and sprintB)
# Drag issueA to sprintA
# Start sprintA
# Search issueA in the search text box located in the top left section of the backlog view
# Drag issueA into sprintA

h3. Expected Results
issueA is allow to drag and drop into sprintA then a scope change message will be triggered.

h3. Actual Results
When drag and drop issueA into sprintA, issueA will be drop to sprintB itself.

h3.Workaround
Use the normal backlog to manually search for the particular then drag it into sprintA
fields.summary: In the backlog, unable to drag and drop a filtered issues into an active sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When copying a board, the position values in of Quick Filters and Swimlanes are not copied. It sometimes leads to showing the wrong order of Quick Filters and Swimlanes of the newly copied board with the original one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to board management page
# Copy that board, Swimlanes and QuickFilters will be copied as well
# Check POS value in AO_60DB71_SWIMLANE and AO_60DB71_QUICKFILTER of the new board now are reset to 0.

h3. Expected Results
POS value in AO_60DB71_SWIMLANE and AO_60DB71_QUICKFILTER in the copied board must be the same as original one to keep the same order.
h3. Actual Results
POS value in AO_60DB71_SWIMLANE and AO_60DB71_QUICKFILTER in the copied board are reset to 0, the order is not ensured keeping the same the the original one.
h3.Workaround
No
fields.summary: Copying a board doesn't copy the position value for Quick Filters / Swimlanes and reset them to 0

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Drag-and-Drop feature on Agile Boards is only available if the board is filtered by Rank
If the board is filtered to something other than Rank, the drag-and-drop functionality does not work
In addition, it is no longer possible to move issues to sprints either through drag-and-drop nor by Right Click > Move to Sprint

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Drag-and-Drop and Right Click > Move to 'Sprint X' for boards sorted or ranked by another custom field
 
h3. Workaround 
Edit Board Filter so that it is only ordered by Rank:
{{ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
fields.summary: Allow Drag-and-Drop on Boards Not Filtered by Rank

fields.description:
In the agile wallboard gadget for the home screen there seems to be no quick link to the actual board itself. Links to the individual issues are good, but not enough.

If the user checks the 'show board name' in the gadget config, the board name is located in a sensible spot. It would be great if this board name could also be a quick link to the agile board itself to save the pain of navigating through the agile menu for a board you're already looking at.

On another note, it would be great if the cards on the board could be interacted with in the gadget. This would save a great deal of effort and allow a user to bring multiple boards to one screen without having to traverse their projects.

fields.description:
It would be interesting to know the required conditions and what's the real purpose of the new button that appears in a JIRA Agile board when the swimlanes are decided based on the Stories in the project.

As of now, the button seems to appear whenever sub-tasks of the story are not in the same column as the story, so this button should be used to move the story to the same column, however, it still appears even when the story and its sub-tasks are under the same column in some cases.
!New_feature.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the documentation regarding JIRA Agile new feature.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA Agile, when creating an issue for a project different than the current one, you get a message saying {{Your issue XX-XX has been created but is not currently visible}} and it doesn't give you a reason why it's not showing. This issue gets excluded from the current board and doesn't appear in the backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful to have a tool similar to the _Permissions Helper_, so we can insert the name of the issue and know why the filter is excluding from the current board.
 
h3. Workaround 
There are two possible workarounds:
- Go to the actual Project where you created the issue and look for it in the backlog. In some cases you'll need to clear the filters for it to apply.
- Modify the board's filter as per [Configuring filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Filters].
fields.summary: Board helper to understand why issues are not visible

2. Convert a sub-task to an issue.

Expected Result:
The converted sub-task stays in the sprint

Actual Result:
The converted sub-task moves out of the sprint.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*When closing a sprint, any unfinished tasks are moved to 'the top of backlog' according to the dialog*, but in fact they end up in the first not-started sprint. Since we have multiple teams working on overlapping projects, we regularly have sprints from team A showing on the board of team B. When this happens, any unfinished tasks from team A may end up in a not-started sprint from team B.

It would be very nice if instead of automatically putting the unfinished tasks in some sprint, we could choose where to put them (possibly including the actual backlog). This doesn't have to be per issue, I just want to specify where the whole lot goes...
fields.summary: Allow choosing where to put unfinished issues

In addition I want to have an option to disable the current sidebar issue detail view on boards.

(i) Trello for example has implemented it that way.
fields.summary: Option to show Issue detail view as a bigger central panel instead of side panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When changing configuration related to the calendars at *JIRA Administration > System*, some changes doesn't take place within JIRA Agile. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Change calendar configuration format as per [Customizing the Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+the+Look+and+Feel], in the section Date/Time format:
# Go to *JIRA Administration > System > Look and Feel*
# Set Date/Time format to 24 hours yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm  
# Check the box at the bottom to make Monday first day of the week, as per [How to set Monday as First Day of Week|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/How+to+Set+Monday+as+First+Day+of+Week+in+Date+Picker+Calendar]
# Go to *JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > Advanced Settings* and enter the format (_sysadmin_ only):
- jira.date.time.picker.java.format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
- jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format: %Y-%m-%d %H:%M

h3. Expected Results
Calendars will be showing Monday as first day of the week, and time will be displayed in 24 hours format

h3. Actual Results
Calendars within JIRA Agile are still showing Sunday as first day of the week and am/pm format (see screenshots). The way date is displayed will change, but time seems to have no effect. In JIRA all changes have taken place correctly.

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Changing calendar settings doesn't affect calendars within JIRA Agile

fields.description: On the plan view make all the mandatory field optional except maybe the key so as users of the system we can have what we want on the issue line. In addition why not all the length of each field display changeable?
fields.summary: The additional fields allowed on the Plan view to all be on one line.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If I'm looking at an epic, one of the things I often want to do is look at all the issues in the epic in the issue navigator and then filter on them.  

For example, today I wanted to check that none of the issues in my epic are in the "Needs Triage" state, that stops them being on the rapid board we use.  I spent way too long trying to figure out how to do this without going to the issue navigator and then using JQL.  

I think an appropriate place for this would be the little dropdown that you get for Sub-Tasks.  I know that epics don't currently have that dropdown, but obviously they should.  An issue with a collection of issues in it should probably list the issues the same way by default.  I can't immediately think why the sub-task list should contain "Show All" and "Show Open" menu options but the "Issues in Epic list shouldn't".  My guess is just different developers.
fields.summary: Epic issue view should provide a way to view issues in the issue navigator

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary
Changes in Epic link field does not trigger listener for "Issue Updated" event. As an example, Webhook will not fire when it is configured for "Issue Updated" and the only change for the issue is on the Epic link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a listener for "Issue Updated" 
# Update just Epic Link field, 

h3. Actual Result:
Listener is not triggered. 

h3. Expected Result:
Listener is triggered.

h3. Notes
This is the only field that has the problem. All other fields (standard, custom, Agile, etc.) do not exhibit this problem. 

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22645060/sil-listener-script-not-being-called-on-issue-update
fields.summary: Change in Epic Link field does not trigger listener

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Y axis of the CFD report (JIRA Agile) should display a range that +(vertically) magnifies the data for the specific timeframe shown+.

*Current behavior:*
The scale of the Y axis (issue count) starts from 0, regardless of the timeframe being shown.
The effect is that long-running CFDs tend to look flat when one inspects a relatively short portion of the time (i.e. one week, for an initiative that has been running since several months or years). This doesn't help to appreciate bottlenecks, trends and other KPIs that such report is supposed to provide.

*Expected behavior*
The scale of the Y axis is offset to the number of issues that were in the "lower-layer" status at the start of the timeframe considered (i.e. ~450 in the attachment)
The benefit is that data are readable, regardless of the timeframe selected: trends can be better appreciated because the Y axis "zooms" to just the relevant range
fields.summary: Y axis of Cumulative Flow Diagram report should scale automatically

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-12297].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When an issue that's in a backlog gets moved from one project to another the sprint will come with it. That causes a lot of confusion if sprints are not being tracked across projects as the sprint will exist on both boards and changing one will change the other. In addition it's not possible to start the sprint unless you have administrator access across both boards and projects.

h3. Suggested Solution

It's a tricky one to solve - but perhaps making the sprint field visible on the move issue process will make end users more likely to remove the sprint value.
 
h3. Workaround 

Manually remove the sprint value yourself.
fields.summary: Moving an issue that belongs to a sprint across projects shouldn't move the sprint with it

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Environment Details* :
Browser : Firefox (tested against 35.0.1)
OS : Redhat or Ubuntu (tested against Ubuntu 14.0.4)
JIRA 6.8.4
Agile 6.7.7

*Issue*: 
JIRA Agile consumes common keyboard shortcuts in Firefox

*Steps to Reproduce:*
- Open 3 tabs in Firefox
- Browse to an Agile board (I used the example scrum board) on the first tab and ensure you're on planning
- Press alt + 2 to switch to the next tab in Firefox

*Outcome*
You'll find that you've just changed to the active sprint rather than the second tab

*Expected Results*
It would be expected that you would land on the second tab open in Firefox
fields.summary: JIRA Agile should not collide with the tab number keyboard shortcuts in Firefox

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Original summary: Display each sprint's board name and/or ID in the sprint field's drop-down option

h3.Problem
I'm refering to the problem mentioned here:
* [Cannot end sprint because I am not the administrator for other projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Cannot+end+sprint+because+I+am+not+the+administrator+for+other+projects]

Person A is administrator of ABC project/ board but does not have access to XYZ
Person B is administrator of XYZ project/ board but does not have access to ABC
Person C is a developer who works in both ABC and XYZ

ABC has a sprint called "Sprint 1" (id = 1)
XYZ has a sprint called "Sprint 1" (id = 2)

As C is working for both projects, when picking the sprint from sprint custom field, C accidentially sets sprint of XYZ-1 to "Sprint 1" (id = 1).
A wants to complete his sprint but unable to do so because of the problem described in the KB article linked above.

{panel}
we have hundreds of projects and thousands of users working across multiple projects in our JIRA system. Project administrators don't like to be bothered about going through workarounds each time when this happens.
{panel}

h3.Suggestion
To minimize accidental usage of the wrong sprint, would it be possible to indicate the sprint ID and the board name of that sprint in each of the drop-down options list when changing the sprint? (Screenshoht: [^sprint.png])
This is a cosmetic change but it will help JIRA users to distinguish the correct sprint.

--
Thanks!
Shaakunthala
fields.summary: Improve the information about a sprint in the sprint picker on View Issue page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Yesterday sometimes get broken and bar with swimlane titles is displayed wrong. I've attached a screenshot. This is very annoying because I can't see first row of tickets in kanban board.
fields.summary: Bar with swimlane titles is displayed wrong on Safari 8.0.6

fields.description: As a dashboard user i want to be able to group stories by Epic Name and Epic Key in X or Y axis.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Gadget: Support of group by Epics

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an epic from the create epic link, the user selects the fields they wish to view using the configure button.  The next time an epic is created, the configuration is forgotten and the user must choose it again.  When creating an epic from the Create button, the configuration is remembered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JIRA Agile project
# Click the Epic sidebar
# Select Create Epic
# Configure the screen to include 'Assignee' field
# Create Epic
# Repeat Step 3
# The field configuration has been forgotten and the user must complete step 4 again

h3. Expected Results
The field configuration should be remembered.
h3. Actual Results
The user has to repeat the behavior every time.

h3.Workaround
Click the field configuration option every time or use the 'Create' button on the main navigation bar instead of the Create Epic link.
fields.summary: Create epic does not apply the field configuration set in the Configure Fields dropdown

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are trying to release about 1991 issues, As the summary says, bug GHS-11775 is reproduced but issues are not being updated.

We can see version created and "released" but when we dig on the issues included in that version, we only see 1987, and when we go back to de board we still get the 1991 issues pending release.
fields.summary: Experiencing bug GHS-11775 but issues aint being updated.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a user I would like to have the assignee field on the create epic screen without clicking on the configure fields option.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Click create epic
# The assignee field is already visible

h3. Workaround 
Click the configure fields option, check "assignee"
fields.summary: As a user, I would like assignee to appear on the create epic screen without configuring the screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when you have an issue in Project A, and you assign a sprint to it in Project B, then different boards will both show the same sprint.

This is a problem because changes being made in one of the projects will reflect on the other project as well. (closing sprint for example).
Nowhere in JIRA Agile are we warned that adding this issue will make the sprint overlap projects.


h3. Suggested Solution

Make this information visible through a warning message within JIRA Agile.
The idea is to make it clear for the user which Sprint from the dropdown in coming from which Rapid board. Perhaps add board-Sprint relation in the dropdown to prevent users from selecting the wrong Sprint by mistake.
fields.summary: As a user I want to get a warning when I enter a Sprint Name that already exists in a different project.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently unmapped statuses on boards do not create any warning and effect the filters used on boards.  Unfortunately if you do not know there is a status that is unmapped, you cannot know that your filters will not work.  This effects burndowns and provides inaccurate views. As a feature, I would like to see a warning banner for an "invalid board" if there are unmapped statuses.
fields.summary: Unmapped statuses on boards should create an error condition

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: "The burndown chart and sprint report both use the same graph and reporting process. The chart will include any issue that was given a value for its estimation field. It is possible to change the issue type to something that does not have the estimation field associated with it. At this point, those issues should stop counting toward the burndown."
fields.summary: Sprint burndown chart behaviour for issues changed to a non-estimatable type

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Control Chart is not currently available as a dashboard gadget. As a user I would like to see this report on my dashboard.
fields.summary: Make Control Chart report a dashboard gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If custom multi-line text fields are added to the side bar, they appear inline with the field name.  
This causes all the text to be condensed and less readable. 
Please see the attached screenshots.

h3. Suggested Solution
Move the text box under the text field to make it look much neater and more readable.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like custom multi-line text fields to appear under the fieldname in the JIRA Agile detail view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Reproduction:
1. Create a new future sprint 
2. Create an issue and drag it into the future sprint
3. Update workflow property of "Closed" status and set jira.issue.editable to true
4. Close the issue.
5. Update workflow property of "Closed" status and set jira.issue.editable to false
6. Delete the future sprint 
Result :  Error: This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status.
Expected: When closing the issue, it is removed from future sprint
fields.summary: Closing an issue in a future sprint when jira.issue.editable is set to true won't remove it from the sprint and it leads to an error when a user tries to delete the future sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
From the issue page if you click "view on board" the UI changes to display a darkened version of the page and a spinner suggesting that a modal is about to be displayed. After a few seconds the browser is redirected to a new page. 

The veil and the modal suggest a change that never occurs.
fields.summary: Clicking the View on Board link from an issue causes a veil to be thrown up when the user should just be redirected

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I'm using the "Agile Sprint Health", and "Agile Sprint Burndown" widgets on my dashboard

All are set to Sprint = "Next Sprint Due (auto)".
Auto refresh is ticked on "Agile Sprint Health"
Refresh interval is set to every 15 minutes

But the "Agile Sprint Health" widget isn't changing sprint automatically when one ends and another starts - I need to edit the dashboard in System > System Dashboard and re-save the gadget.

The "Agile Sprint Burndown" gadget is behaving as expected - the dashboard showed the new active sprint without requiring interaction from me.

Attached screenshot of my config for reference.

Cloned from a similar issue (GHS-11955) which was set to be fixed in Agile 6.7.6 but we are on 6.7.7 and still unresolved.

Cheers
fields.summary: "Agile Sprint Health" gadgets doesn't auto-switch sprints (but "Agile Sprint Burndown" gadget does)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently JIRA Agile uses the estimate at the time when the issue was added to the sprint, or when the sprint began (if the issue was in sprint before it started).

As a Scrum Master, I would like for JIRA Agile to use the estimates on issues at the time I start the sprint, not the estimates present as of the date/time I select as the sprint start date.

----

Example:
* Sprint created, not yet started
* Issues with estimates are added to sprint
* During sprint kickoff, estimate on a issue in sprint is changed
* Sprint is started with a start date/time selected by the user. Time chosen is prior to the estimate change on the issue
** Time selected might be start of day, start of business day, or perhaps the start of the kickoff meeting
* JIRA Agile reports on the estimate that existed on the sprint start date instead of using the estimate that is present on the issue when the sprint is started
fields.summary: Use estimates present on issues at time sprint is started, regardless of user selected sprint start date/time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is outcome of DoS investigation of https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-18987

Steps to reproduce
# ensure that You have 2 issue statuses that ID of the first one is prefix of the second one.
eq. status11 that has id 11 and status111 that has id 111.
# create an agile board with those statuses configured.
# Move issue from the longer status id to the shorter status id. The dialog should be presented and trigger should be registered on 'a[href*='action=11'].issueaction-workflow-transition'
# now when You move issue from shorter status 11 to longer 111 another dialog will be created with trigger a[href*='action=111'].issueaction-workflow-transition and that trigger will be triggered. but the longer trigger "href*='action=111'" also satisfies the previous "href*='action=11'" so there will be 2 dialogs triggered (2 network operation) and incorrect dialog will be displayed.

I think that there is an error in the file gh-InitDialogs.js
{code}
trigger: 'a[href*="' + action[0] + '"].issueaction-workflow-transition',
{code}
this selector makes possible to trigger multiple times (multiple forms).
Or maybe the forms should be removed along with the triggers after closing.
fields.summary: Issues don't transition to correct status in Agile Board

fields.summary: Velocity chart uses outdated data

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a recent update, icons associated with stories and epics, for example, are showing as broken

h3. Environment
JIRA + JIRA Agile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View *Issue Types* {{~/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa}}, and any icons that are broken will show the name of the issue type twice, (e.g. Story *Story*).

h3. Expected Results
The icons should be loading for each issue type from this page

h3. Actual Results
In my example, the missing story icon is located at {{~/download/resources/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-webactions/images/ico_story.png}}

h3.Workaround
# From *Issue Types* page, Click *Edit* under Operations for the issue type with the missing icon
# Choose an Icon from the following page, and save.
fields.summary: Story and Epic icons are broken

fields.description: I have a jira issue (story) in which I linked an epic to. I go to update the epic value to another epic or I try to clear it. It allows me to save the updated value but it's not reflected after the save. It still references the old epic in the epic field.
fields.summary: Changing Epic value on an issue is not being updated
